channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12636] Avoid too many write operations on zookeeper in replication
item.description:
In our production cluster, we found there are about over 1k write operations per second on zookeeper from hbase replication. The reason is that the replication source will write the log position to zookeeper for every edit shipping. If the current replicating WAL is just the WAL that regionserver is writing to, each skipping will be very small but the frequency is very high, which causes many write operations on zookeeper.

A simple solution is that writing log position to zookeeper when position diff or skipped edit number is larger than a threshold, not every edit shipping.

Suggestions are welcomed, thx~
item.summary: Avoid too many write operations on zookeeper in replication

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Patch for trunk
Means in the event of failure we could double replicate some entries, right?
What about recording this information into a system table instead? We can start the migration of replication state out of ZooKeeper.

Means in the event of failure we could double replicate some entries, right?

Yes. Thats ok though, right?

What about recording this information into a system table instead? We can start the migration of replication state out of ZooKeeper.

Yes. In a separate JIRA?

Patch LGTM (The background code looks to be duplicated)

Yes. In a separate JIRA?

I'd say not ideally. Nobody's going to work on it. We keep putting it off. Now we're putting band aids on the problem.
unLogPositionEntries is always 0 in this patch?

Andrew Purtell

What about recording this information into a system table instead? We can start the migration of replication state out of ZooKeeper.

Agree. We may start to work on it in next month.

Enis Soztutar

unLogPositionEntries is always 0 in this patch?

Yes. I forgot to add the currentSize to unLogPositionEntries after edits are skippped.
Update for Enis Soztutar's review
Will commit in next day unless objection.

This message is automatically generated.

Is it really OK to double replicate data? It's not doing that now, right?
It's especially bad when two clusters are setup in master-master replication and both are active.

If you all feel that's OK, let's commit... -0 from me.

Is it really OK to double replicate data? It's not doing that now, right?

The duplicate will just overwrite. Counters will be slightly off. I was thinking this only repercussion. Better than buckling your local zk ensemble with updates I'd say.

Fine holding on commit till gets a bit more attention.

Was thinking that if both cluster are active a write that is repeated much later will might cause issues.

We can also drive down the frequency of the checks... Maybe? I.e. if the frequency is too high, just check a little less often and let more data accumulate.

if the frequency is too high, just check a little less often and let more data accumulate.

That'd keep current 'style'.

Lars Hofhansl stack
Repeated replication data will happen in many cases in current codebase.

  • The network problem which make master cluster did not get response of replication but the replication data has been written into in slave cluster.
  • A moving region in salve cluster which make the replication failed, but part of replication data has been into in slave cluster.

This patch just make repeated replication data more frequently.

We may open another issue to check if the replication operation is idempotent?

Lars Hofhansl stack
Any suggestions about this patch?
The write operations to zookeeper from replication decrease to several hundreds from 5 thousands per second in our cluster with this patch.

stack Lars Hofhansl Andrew Purtell
Any more suggestions about this patch? Could you help to push this?

Current patch appears to address specific feedback points to date and is an incremental improvement. I'm +1 for master unless someone has further objections.

Liu Shaohui can you get me a rebased patch for master? the current one doesn't apply.

Sorry... Missed this.

The patch's approach is to perform the replication and simply not log every advance.

If I understand the issue correctly this is for the case we write into the cluster at a medium pace and hence each check on whether there's something to replicate would only find a few edits. Hence another approach is to simply slow down replication a bit. I.e. if we only have a few edits we wait a bit longer to edits to come in, only then we replicate the data and advance the pointer in ZK. That would also improve replication efficiency.
